TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed UnmanagedType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Identifies how to marshal parameters or fields to unmanaged code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the UnmanagedType enumeration with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalAsAttribute?displayProperty=fullName> attribute to specify how types are marshaled during interoperation with unmanaged code. You can use this enumeration to marshal code using simple value types (I1, I2, I4, I8, R4, R8, U2, U4, and U8), unmanaged types that are unavailable in the .NET Framework, and various miscellaneous types.
For more information, see [Interoperating with Unmanaged Code](../Topic/Interoperating%20with%20Unmanaged%20Code.md).
## Examples The following code fragment demonstrates how to declare, in managed source code, an unmanaged interface implemented by a COM component. The <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComImportAttribute?displayProperty=fullName> attribute prevents the `IMyStorage` interface from being exported back for use by COM. (COM clients should use the existing COM component directly.) In this example, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalAsAttribute> specifies serveral UnmanagedType members, which represent the types used by the original COM interface.
[!code-cpp[ImprovedInteropSnippets#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.interop_20_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ImprovedInteropSnippets#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.interop_20_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ImprovedInteropSnippets#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.interop_20_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType AnsiBStr = int32(35)

Docs.summary: An ANSI character string that is a length-prefixed single byte. You can use this member on the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType AsAny = int32(40)

Docs.summary: A dynamic type that determines the type of an object at run time and marshals the object as that type. This member is valid for platform invoke methods only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType Bool = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A 4-byte Boolean value ( != 0, = 0). This is the Win32 BOOL type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType BStr = int32(19)

Docs.summary: A Unicode character string that is a length-prefixed double byte. You can use this member, which is the default string in COM, on the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType ByValArray = int32(30)

Docs.summary: When the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalAsAttribute.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to , the field must be set to indicate the number of elements in the array. The field can optionally contain the UnmanagedType of the array elements when it is necessary to differentiate among string types. You can use this UnmanagedType only on an array that whose elements appear as fields in a structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType ByValTStr = int32(23)

Docs.summary: Used for in-line, fixed-length character arrays that appear within a structure. The character type used with ByValTStr is determined by the argument of the attribute applied to the containing structure. Always use the field to indicate the size of the array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework ByValTStr types behave like C-style, fixed-size strings inside a structure (for example, `char s[5]`). The behavior in managed code differs from the Microsoft Visual Basic 6.0 behavior, which is not null terminated (for example, `MyString As String * 5`).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType Currency = int32(15)

Docs.summary: A currency type. Used on a to marshal the decimal value as a COM currency type instead of as a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType CustomMarshaler = int32(44)

Docs.summary: Specifies the custom marshaler class when used with the or field. The field can be used to pass additional information to the custom marshaler. You can use this member on any reference type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType Error = int32(45)

Docs.summary: A native type that is associated with an I4 or an U4 and that causes the parameter to be exported as an HRESULT in the exported type library.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType FunctionPtr = int32(38)

Docs.summary: An integer that can be used as a C-style function pointer. You can use this member on a data type or on a type that inherits from a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType HString = int32(47)

Docs.summary: A [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/add/includes/wrt-md.md)] string. You can use this member on the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType I1 = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A 1-byte signed integer. You can use this member to transform a Boolean value into a 1-byte, C-style ( = 1, = 0).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType I2 = int32(5)

Docs.summary: A 2-byte signed integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType I4 = int32(7)

Docs.summary: A 4-byte signed integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType I8 = int32(9)

Docs.summary: An 8-byte signed integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType IDispatch = int32(26)

Docs.summary: A COM pointer ( in Microsoft Visual Basic 6.0).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType IInspectable = int32(46)

Docs.summary: A [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/add/includes/wrt-md.md)] interface pointer. You can use this member on the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType Interface = int32(28)

Docs.summary: A COM interface pointer. The of the interface is obtained from the class metadata. Use this member to specify the exact interface type or the default interface type if you apply it to a class. This member produces the same behavior as IUnknown when you apply it to the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType IUnknown = int32(25)

Docs.summary: A COM pointer. You can use this member on the data type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType LPArray = int32(42)

Docs.summary: A pointer to the first element of a C-style array. When marshaling from managed to unmanaged code, the length of the array is determined by the length of the managed array. When marshaling from unmanaged to managed code, the length of the array is determined from the and fields, optionally followed by the unmanaged type of the elements within the array when it is necessary to differentiate among string types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType LPStr = int32(20)

Docs.summary: A single byte, null-terminated ANSI character string. You can use this member on the and data types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType LPStruct = int32(43)

Docs.summary: A pointer to a C-style structure that you use to marshal managed formatted classes. This member is valid for platform invoke methods only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType LPTStr = int32(22)

Docs.summary: A platform-dependent character string: ANSI on Windows 98, and Unicode on Windows NT and Windows XP. This value is supported only for platform invoke and not for COM interop, because exporting a string of type is not supported.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType LPWStr = int32(21)

Docs.summary: A 2-byte, null-terminated Unicode character string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Note that you cannot use the LPWStr value with an unmanaged string unless the string was created by using the unmanaged `CoTaskMemAlloc` function.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType R4 = int32(11)

Docs.summary: A 4-byte floating-point number.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType R8 = int32(12)

Docs.summary: An 8-byte floating-point number.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType SafeArray = int32(29)

Docs.summary: A , which is a self-describing array that carries the type, rank, and bounds of the associated array data. You can use this member with the field to override the default element type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType Struct = int32(27)

Docs.summary: A VARIANT, which is used to marshal managed formatted classes and value types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType SysInt = int32(31)

Docs.summary: A platform-dependent, signed integer: 4 bytes on 32-bit Windows, 8 bytes on 64-bit Windows.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType SysUInt = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A platform-dependent, unsigned integer: 4 bytes on 32-bit Windows, 8 bytes on 64-bit Windows.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType TBStr = int32(36)

Docs.summary: A length-prefixed, platform-dependent string: ANSI on Windows 98, Unicode on Windows NT. You rarely use this BSTR-like member.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType U1 = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A 1-byte unsigned integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType U2 = int32(6)

Docs.summary: A 2-byte unsigned integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType U4 = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A 4-byte unsigned integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType U8 = int32(10)

Docs.summary: An 8-byte unsigned integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType VariantBool = int32(37)

Docs.summary: A 2-byte, OLE-defined VARIANT_BOOL type ( = -1, = 0).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType VBByRefStr = int32(34)

Docs.summary: A value that enables Visual Basic to change a string in unmanaged code and have the results reflected in managed code. This value is only supported for platform invoke.
